channel.title: Router Assistance
channel.description:
Alright, I'm having a hard time with NETGEAR customer support because we don't have warranty, and frankly don't have a card to hand to them, so we can't get customer support.
So I'm having a problem with the router, and it seems to be not sending out Wi-Fi signals to like the Xbox, Labtop etc., and I've tried a lot of things to see if it would work but seems to not be working...
So does someone have a suggestion?

item.title: Router Assistance
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

[quote=“iCreatedHorror, post:4, topic:397404”]Every time we lose the signal randomly (we have Linksys), meaning no signal is being picked up by laptops, xbox, etc., we have to reset it.
Happens to us 1-2 times a week it seems.

It will be on, but no signal gets sent and we cannot even access the information page where, for example, you would port forward.[/quote]
Yeah, I just fixed the stupid problem and that’s exactly what I had to do plus a power cycle. I’ve lost all my stuff such as passwords and stuff connected with the Router, but hey, I at least fixed it.

Read full topic

item.title: Router Assistance
item.dc:creator: @iCreatedHorror Ryan
item.description:
@iCreatedHorror wrote:

Every time we lose the signal randomly (we have Linksys), meaning no signal is being picked up by laptops, xbox, etc., we have to reset it.
Happens to us 1-2 times a week it seems.

It will be on, but no signal gets sent and we cannot even access the information page where, for example, you would port forward.

Read full topic

item.title: Router Assistance
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

Yeah, it states that the wireless is online.

Wireless Port Name (SSID) Wireless-Connection Region United States Channel 11 Mode b and g Wireless AP ON Broadcast Name ON

Read full topic

item.title: Router Assistance
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Can you check the settings and see if wi-fi is enabled? I know my router has an option for that

Read full topic

item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

Alright, I’m having a hard time with NETGEAR customer support because we don’t have warranty, and frankly don’t have a card to hand to them, so we can’t get customer support.

So I’m having a problem with the router, and it seems to be not sending out Wi-Fi signals to like the Xbox, Labtop etc., and I’ve tried a lot of things to see if it would work but seems to not be working…

So does someone have a suggestion?
